question: 届く
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>deliver</kanji> so the verb vocab version here is <vocabulary>to be delivered</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to arrive</vocabulary>. You know this one is "to be delivered" (aka it's just getting delivered, you aren't doing the delivery) because when this item arrives at your house you say "<reading>coo'</reading>" (<ja>く</ja>), it arrived.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the one you learned with the kanji: <ja>とど</ja>!
